definitions.definition: To notice or view, especially carefully or with attention to detail.
definitions.example: From this vantage point we can observe the behavior of the animals in their natural habitat.

definitions.definition: To follow or obey the custom, practice, or rules (especially of a religion).
definitions.example: Please observe all posted speed limits.

definitions.definition: To take note of and celebrate (a holiday or similar occurrence).
To comment on something; to make an observation.
definitions.example: The senator observed that the bill would be detrimental to his constituents.
